resourceType.description: Value that identifies the type of the domain resource this event is related to

resourceVersion.description: Version of this API resource (domain event)

id.description: Unique (UUID) identifier of the event. Used for detecting duplicates. populate this if the header X-B3-TraceId is not available

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 UTC date time of when the event was triggered from source. Used for handling out of order events (ISO 8601)

actionCode.description: Reason why the event was fired. More detailed than 'type' field.

sourceSystemName.description: Source Sytem where the event has originated

subscriberIdentifier.description: Subscriber Identifier to be sent in case of RESENDs to particular subscriber

id.description: Transaction Tracking UUId.  A universally unique identifier (UUID) is a 128-bit number used to uniquely identify a specific row of information within an organized set of data

idReferenceType.description: Type of Id Reference Number.  Enumeration of Values: GOODSHOLDER, BOL, PACKLIST, DELIVERY, SOURCEID

idReferenceNumber.description: "Functional key to uniquely identify a specific shipment.  Is the basis (i.e. lookup) for setting the UUID value. Example: ShippingPointCode_TransportHolderNumber_PackListNumber (concatenation of key) "

shipmentNumber.description: The number that uniquely identifies the shipment document. A shipment is a group of deliveries that will be handled as a group. This is available only in case of SIM, SAP S4 producer

shipmentTypeSystemCode.description: A set of alphanumeric characters that uniquely identifies what type of transportation processing is to be performed. Example: z041 (meaning Decon DRS shipment). Code is Specific to SAP

shipmentTypeSystemDescription.description: The text associated with Shipment System Type Code. Description is Specific to SAP

shipmentTypeCode.description: The Type of Shipment defined by Shipment Services

shipmentSubTypeSystemCode.description:
This is higher level Shipment Type Classification in SAP S4. Current Values include
Inbound, NBY(Nike By Pass), DC By Pass"

salesChannelTypeName.description:
Define Wholesale/Digital/Retail.
This is enumerated in swagger
enum:
        - DIGITAL
        - WHOLESALE
        - RETAIL

bolNumber.description: Identifies the Bill of Lading (BOL) or the Master Air Way Bill (MAWB) with which the goods are to be transported. Example: 615566602

originalShipmentNumber.description: Nike Original Shipment Number.  If Shipment is diverted, this acts as a reference to link to the original shipment.

packlistNumber.description: An identifer for the Packlist which identifies and accompanies the shipment. It is synomous with Shipment Reference Number (not yet placed in this model).   For single delivery, which is created by the warehouse management system and can contain a bundling of multiple deliveries going to the same Ship-to (i.e. Major).  When a shipment contains a single delivery (i.e. minor), the delivery number is used.  For multiple delivery shipments (i.e. major), the actual packlist is used. example: 615566602

splitCount.description: The split count of the shipment when the idReferenceNumber is split.

splitStatusCode.description: this is populated if the shipment (idReferenceNumber) itself is a Split with correct status. PARTIAL in case of a partial, FINAL when the current shipment is the final of the split, and populated with SINGLE if there is no split.

exportIndicator.description:
Answers the question if a shipment passes customs.
Example: True

shipmentStatusCode.description: Shipment status code denoting the status of the shipment in Ship domain

shipmentStatusSystemCode.description:
A set of characters that uniquely identifies the status of the Shipment. Example: 7 (meaning Shipment End) Example Value: 0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7 SAP Detail: STTRG - Overall transportation status MDR ID: 10287
The code is specific to SAP system

shipmentStatusSystemDescription.description: Text describing the shipmentStatusSystemCode. The description values are specific to values defined in SAP

proNumber.description: The pro number of the shipment. Identifier for the freight that this shipment was sent with. Can be the master BOL number, the container number or CMR number (only available after actual shipment). Example: 100033388

transportVehicleTypeDescription.description: Type of Transportation Vehicle description associated with the TransportationVehicleCode.

transportationMeansCode.description: Type of Load for this shipment PARCEL/LTL/TL with in the Truck/container.

legIndicatorCode.description: A set of numbers that uniquely identifies whether a shipment is a stand alone shipment or one of multiple linked shipments in a sequence. Example value: 1 (meaning Preliminary Leg) 2 (meaning Main Leg) 3 (meaning Subsequent Leg) 4 (meaning Direct Leg) SAP Detail: LAUFK MDR ID: 10594 - SAP specific Values

legIndicatorDescription.description: Text describing the LegIndicatorCode, value defined by SAP

companyCode.description: Nike based Company Code and values are same as SAP values

companyDescription.description: Text describing the Company Code and is same as values in SAP.

executionOrganizationSystemCode.description: Transportation Planning Point in SAP, tells which Organization is responsible for execution of the shipment. Values are specific to SAP ENum

shipmentVoyageNumber.description: The alphanumeric characters that uniquely identify which trip of a vessel (i.e. ship, airplane, or truck) the goods are loaded on for the shipment. This is assigned by the principal agent of the vessel and is typically the total number of trips the vessel has made. Examples: 103W5 (meaning 103 total trips but the current trip is heading West to the 5th port of call)SAP Detail: TDLINE - Text

oneSKUPerGoodsHolderIndicator.description: This is used by DRS and indicates if a Goods Holder or all goods holders contains only one type of product (SKU) or not. example: false

shipmentTrackingNumber.description: The tracking number of the shipment (on shipment level). THis could be proNumber, Packlist, BOL, leading carton Number, example: 00000912040581689436

nextLegOriginIdTypeCode.description: Type of location  code for this shipment's next leg. usually populated on a multi leg shipment

nextLegOriginIdCode.description: location  code for this shipment's next leg. usually populated on a multi leg shipment

totalNumberOfContainerCount.description:
Total Number Of Container Count.
example: 1

goodsHolderTypeCode.description: Indicates what type of goods holder is being counted in the "goodsHolderCount" field. example: "CARTON"

goodsHolderCount.description:
Number of goods holders connected to the transport holder.
Example: 1

costCalculationStatusCode.description: overall cost calculation status for this shipment

iDPIndicator.description: Indicator that shows if a shipment is sent to an Individual Delivery Plan customer, that can select a certain time window for the delivery of a shipment. Example: false

deliveryInstructionText.description: Free format field that contains information for the delivery of a shipment. Example: Delivery at the green door

shipViaCode.description: A code that indicates Mode + carrier + service level. The code is defined by Nike Business

shipViaDescription.description: A text that describes the Nike Ship via code.

actualServiceLevelCode.description: Actual/FInal Service level code of the Shipment finalized with Carrier

plannedServiceLevelCode.description: Planned Service level code received from SAP or DOMS when the Order was created

houseAirwayBillNumber.description: house airway bill number provided by the carrier for Air freight shipments

masterAirwayBillNumber.description: Master airway bill number provided by the carrier for Air freight shipments

multiLegBOLIndicator.description: Indicator to say if same BOL is being used in multiple Shipment in a multi leg scenario. example: false

thirdPartyShipmentSelfIdentifier.description: shipment Identifier of a third party system . one to one with the nike shipment number. eg for AmberRoad this is the Amber road internal key for the nike shipment number

oceanFreightRoutingCode.description: This field indicates the type of oceanfreightRouting. Possible values are IPI – Inland Point Intermodal RIPI - Reverse Inland Point Intermodal This field is specific to US and is only for Vessel shipments

shipmentGroupIdentifier.description: group id of the shipment used to specify the shipment belongs to a group that needs to be processed together

totalItemQuantity.description: total item quantity in the shipment

transportationIntegratorName.description: name or type of transport Integrator that will be responsible for transporting this shipment

consolidationIndicator.description: A transport holder is marked as consolidation if it is coming from a consolidation area

masterBolNumber.description: Identifies the master Bill of Lading Number. This is sent when a customer is set up for it where the customer asks to drop off goods at a hub or a location different than ship to .

customerAuthorizationCode.description: Authorization code provided by the customer to accept a shipment.

routeExecutionNumber.description: Route Execution Number. This represents the unique number that is linked to a certain route.

routeStopSequenceNumber.description: Route Stop Sequence Number. This represents the sequence number of the point where this shipment will be dropped off.

shipmentBookingNumber.description: Booking Number for the shipment available when the carrier booking is done.

freightOrderNumber.description: identifier for the freight order created in SAP for this shipment. this value is available for all shipments posted in SAP and is sent out of SAP system in all egress events

divertIndicator.description:
Answers the question if a shipment is diverted to a new destination, like from customer A to B or customer A to DC.
Example: True

iDPPlannedTimestamp.description: The date and time an Individual Delivery Plan customer wants to receive a shipment. example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

shipmentCreateTimestamp.description: Represents the system date on which the Shipment Document was initially created. This is the original date (static) and does not reflect the date of any updates or changes.Example Value: 20120404SAP Detail: ERDATMDR ID: Similar to 10650 - Outbound Shipment Header Create Date example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

actualShipmentPlannedDate.description:
Actual date on which the shipment is planned.
example: 2018-09-11

plannedCheckpointDate.description: planned date of when the next sub seq leg will start

plannedShipmentReadyTimestamp.description: Date and time the shipment is planned to be ready to be picked up by a vendor. example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

actualShipmentReadyTimestamp.description: Actual date and time the shipment is ready to be picked up by a vendor. example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

plannedShipmentCloseFromTimestamp.description: Start Date and Time the shipment is planned to be closed.Planned GoodsIssue From date

plannedShipmentCloseToTimestamp.description: End Date and Time the shipment is planned to be closed

actualShipmentCloseTimestamp.description: actual Time for when the Shipment was closed.  Expressed in UTC time

actualShippedTimestamp.description: The actual shipment start date of the shipment (only available after actual shipment) example: 2018-09-11

plannedDeliveryFromTimestamp.description:
The starting date and time for the delivery of a shipment
example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

plannedDeliveryToTimestamp.description:
The end date and time for the delivery of a shipment
example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

estimatedDeliveryTimestamp.description:
Estimated Delivery Date and timestamp 
example: 018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

actualDeliveryTimestamp.description: The actual shipment end date and time of the shipment (only available after actual delivery of a shipment) example: 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

actualShipmentReceiptTimestamp.description: The actual shipment receipt end date and time of the shipment example: : 2018-09-11T07:05:37.052Z

costCategoryCode.description: Category of what the cost relates to

paymentTypeCode.description: Method of payment PREPAID/COLLECT associated with the SHipment cost Category

costCurrency.description:
Currency Code associated with Cost Amount.  
Example: USD

shipmentOriginReceiptAddress.description: Address of the Origin Receipt Location . Usually populated when the Origin receipt location (LSP location) is different than the Origin location. Inbound specific entity

shipmentOriginReceiptTypeCode.description: Origin Receipt location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC

shipmentOriginReceiptName2.description: location Name2 of origin receipt if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

addressLine4Text.description: The fourth address line of the address

addressLine5Text.description: The fifth address line of the address

countryCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country of origin of the product

postalCode.description: The zip code of the address

provinceStateRegionCode.description: The province, state or region code of the address

emailAddressText.description: The email address of the location contact if any

telephoneNumber.description: The phone number of the location contact if any

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

shipmentOriginTypeCode.description: Origin location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC etc

shipmentOriginName2.description: location Name2 of origin location if applicable

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

shipmentDischargeTypeCode.description: DISCHARGE location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC etc

shipmentDischargeName.description: Discharge Name of Discharge location if applicable

shipmentDischargeName2.description: location Name2 of Discharge location if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

shipmentDestinationAddress.description: Address of the Destination Location .  this is the Ship to

shipmentDestinationTypeCode.description: Destination location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC etc

shipmentDestinationName.description: location Name of shipment Destination if applicable

shipmentDestinationName2.description: location Name2 of Destination location if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

addressLine4Text.description: The fourth address line of the address

addressLine5Text.description: The fifth address line of the address

telephoneNumber.description: The phone number of the location contact if any

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

thirdPartyLocationSelfIdentifier.description: Self identifier of the customer mark for location

shipmentUltimateDestinationAddress.description: Address of the Ultimate Destination Location .  this is when multiple legs are combined as a direct leg or applicable for multi leg shipment. This entity is specific to Inbound

shipmentUltimateDestinationTypeCode.description: Ultimate Destination location Type code . whether the location is a DC/CUSTOMER etc

shipmentUltimateDestinationName.description: location Name of shipment Ultimate Destination if applicable

shipmentUltimateDestinationName2.description: location Name2 of Ultimate Destination location if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

addressLine4Text.description: The fourth address line of the address

addressLine5Text.description: The fifth address line of the address

countryCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country of origin of the product

postalCode.description: The zip code of the address

provinceStateRegionCode.description: The province, state or region code of the address

emailAddressText.description: The email address of the location contact if any

telephoneNumber.description: The phone number of the location contact if any

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

shipmentVendors.description: A list of Vendors associated with the shipment

vendorTypeCode.description: Type of Vendor whether the Vendor is a Forwarder or Customs Broker or Consolidator etc

vendorCode.description: The code (Nike variant of standard SCAC) of to identify a certain vendor.

hubCode.description: The hub code of identifies a specific location connected to a certain vendor.

subHubCode.description: The sub hub code identifies a specific sub location connected to a certain vendor.

vendorName.description: The name of the vendor, connected to the vendorCode.

addressLine1Text.description: First address line of the Vendor location

addressLine2Text.description: second address line of the Vendor location

addressLine3Text.description: Third address line of the Vendor location

addressLine4Text.description: Fourth address line of the Vendor location

addressLine5Text.description: Fifth address line of the Vendor location

postalCode.description: Zip code of the Vendor location

emailAddressText.description: email Address of the Vendor Contact

telephoneNumber.description: telephone Number of the vendor contact

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: longitude of the location in decimal degrees.

vendorAccessorials.description: List of Accessorials provided by the carrier/vendor

vendorAccessorialCode.description: A Carrier specific code for the accessorials needed by Nike. Eg “SAP”, “RES”.

vendorAccessorialDescription.description: Description of a carrier specific accessorial code. This refers to additional services that the vendor provides . Eg “Saturday Pickup” , “Residential Delivery”.

shipmentActivities.description: This is equivalent to stages in SAP and is populated only when the current shipment has more Legs/activity . example consolidation, movement from A to D where the shipment Origin is A and shipment destination is D but stages are for A->B. B->C, C-> D

activitySequenceNumber.description: sequence Number of the shipment activity. equivalent to stage sequence number in SAP

activityTypeCode.description: Type of activity happening in the stage

vendorCode.description: Vendor associated with performing the activity

activitySiteLocation.description: site location of the activity. populated only if the activity type is not a MOVEMENT. example CONSOLIDATION

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

activityOriginTypeCode.description: activity Origin location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC etc

activityOriginName2.description: location Name2 of activity origin location if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

addressLine4Text.description: The fourth address line of the address

addressLine5Text.description: The fifth address line of the address

countryCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country of origin of the product

postalCode.description: The zip code of the address

provinceStateRegionCode.description: The province, state or region code of the address

emailAddressText.description: The email address of the location contact if any

telephoneNumber.description: The phone number of the location contact if any

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

activityDestinationAddress.description: Address of the activity Destination Location .  this is the current Stage's destination

activityDestinationTypeCode.description: Activity Destination location Type code . whether the location is a IATA/UNLOC etc

activityDestinationName.description: location Name of Activity Destination if applicable

activityDestinationName2.description: location Name2 of Activity destination location if applicable

addressLine1Text.description: The first address line of the address

addressLine2Text.description: The second address line of the address

addressLine3Text.description: The third address line of the address

addressLine4Text.description: The fourth address line of the address

addressLine5Text.description: The fifth address line of the address

countryCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country of origin of the product

postalCode.description: The zip code of the address

provinceStateRegionCode.description: The province, state or region code of the address

emailAddressText.description: The email address of the location contact if any

telephoneNumber.description: The phone number of the location contact if any

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees

shipmentTexts.description: Text relevant to the SHipment . This could be general Text, cancellation reason, return reason

textIdentifier.description: Identifier Code of the Text. All Texts should be qualified by a code in the future Roadmap. contains value like "SD","SO","ZGEN" etc

textDescription.description: Description associated with the Text Identifier

textLineSequenceNumber.description: Sequence Number of the text if source has restrictions on the Text length

shipmentMeasures.description: Measures of the Shipment. if there is only one shipment with in the container this is equal to container measures

eventType.description:
Type of shipment event . Possible values [REBOOKING, TRACK_TRACE]
Example: "REBOOKING"

eventParty.description:
Responsible Party of the shipment event . PPossible values: [ NIKE, CARRIER, CUSTOMER, LINEHAUL ]
Example: "NIKE"

eventTimestamp.description: event timestamp from the carrier when the event actually occurred. This will be in UTC Example: "2017-02-28T16:29:00Z"

eventStatusCode.description:
Nike granular status code corresponding to the carrier status code
Example: "IT1"

eventStatusDescription.description: Nike granular status Description corresponding to the carrier status code/ description Example: "In Transit in Texas"

lifecycleStatusCode.description: Nike lifecycle status code which would be the rolled up status of the granular event status code Example: "IN-TRANSIT"

lifecycleStatusDescription.description: Nike Lifecycle status Description corresponding to the lifecycle status code Example: "In Transit"

vendorStatusCode.description:
Carrier specific granular carrier status code
Example: "004"

vendorStatusDescription.description:
Carrier specific granular carrier status description
Example: "In Transit in Texas"

vendorReasonCode.description: carrier specific reason code for the status code in case of exception. This is populated only in case of exception scenarios in addition to status code Example:"309"

locationCode.description:
location code from where the carrier status event is generated
Exammple: "H100"

cityName.description:
city from where the carrier status event is generated
Example: "Portland"

provinceStateRegionCode.description:
State from where the carrier status event is generated
Example: "OR"

countryCode.description:
Country Code from where the carrier status event is generated
Example: "US"

latitudeDecimalDegree.description:
latitude from where the carrier status event is generated
Example: 39.425

longitudeDecimalDegree.description:
longitude from where the carrier status event is generated
Example: 39.425

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

relatedShipmentsInformation.description: An entity to provide all related shipments associated with this shipment. Used when a shipment is split across multiple container. Used in Inbound. THis enables the consumer to know if they have received all the shipment for a particular BOL

totalShipmentCount.description: Total Number of shipments for one unique BOL

totalGoodsHolderCount.description: total number of cartons across Shipments for one BOL

totalOrderLineCount.description: total Number of Order Lines in all shipments for one BOL

deliveries.description: List of delivery notes associated with the shipment

deliveryNoteNumber.description: A system generated number which uniquely identifies an Delivery Note Document.

receiptId.description: Receipt ID from factory or LSP (logistical service provider, consolidator or carrier).Example value: QTQT000000052593SAP Detail: LIFEXMDR ID:

assignedNodeCode.description: Node code associated with the delivery in case of DRS. for DC inbound this can be same as the destination code or ultimateDestinationCode

incoTermsCode.description: A set of alphanumeric characters that uniquely identify the international rules for the interpretation of the commonly used terms in international trade. An international commercial term (Incoterm) defines the terms of sale and the passing of risks for import and export of merchandise. Examples: EXW (meaning Ex Works) FCA (meaning Free Carriage and Freight) FAS (meaning Free Alongside Ship)MDR ID:  2125

incoTermsCommentsText.description: A freeform text field for additional descriptive information about the incoterms. Example: PORT OF LOADINGMDR ID:  2124

digitalSubChannelCode.description: Sub channel identifier for Digital Hub to know which channel the product belongs to. Segmentation or reserve of inventory in BZ digital hubs for each digital subchannels.    Examples:  Tmall, Nike.com, Tmall YA, Tmall Jordan

goodsHolderTypeCode.description: Type of Good holders thats being counted for this delivery

plannedGoodsReceiptDate.description: create timestamp of delivery in source system

actualGoodsReceiptDate.description: create timestamp of delivery in source system

splitCount.description: The split count of delivery when a delivery is split.

splitStatusCode.description: this is populated if the delivery is a Split with correct status. PARTIAL in case of a partial and there will be more splits, FINAL when the current split is the final one for the delivery, and populated with SINGLE if there is no split.

deliveryCreateTimestamp.description: create timestamp of delivery in source system

deliveryChangeTimestamp.description: change timestamp of delivery in source system

createdByIdentifier.description: created by user id of delivery in source system

updatedByIdentifier.description: changes by user id of delivery in source system

deliveryVendors.description: A list of Vendors associated with the delivery , populated only in case of stock transfer..check if needed in S4

vendorTypeCode.description: Type of Vendor whether the Vendor is a Forwarder or Customs Broker or Consolidator etc

vendorCode.description: The code (Nike variant of standard SCAC) of to identify a certain vendor.

hubCode.description: The hub code of identifies a specific location connected to a certain vendor.

subHubCode.description: The sub hub code identifies a specific sub location connected to a certain vendor.

vendorName.description: The name of the vendor, connected to the vendorCode.

addressLine1Text.description: First address line of the Vendor location

addressLine2Text.description: second address line of the Vendor location

addressLine3Text.description: Third address line of the Vendor location

addressLine4Text.description: Fourth address line of the Vendor location

addressLine5Text.description: Fifth address line of the Vendor location

postalCode.description: Zip code of the Vendor location

emailAddressText.description: email Address of the Vendor Contact

telephoneNumber.description: telephone Number of the vendor contact

languageCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of the language

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: longitude of the location in decimal degrees.

deliveryMarkForStoreAddress.description: Mark for address for delivery if the ship to is different from where the customer requested to ship it

thirdPartyLocationSelfIdentifier.description: Self identifier of the customer mark for location

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

deliverySoldToAddress.description: Sold to address in the delivery note

localTimeZoneCode.description: Local Time Zone code of the location

latitudeDecimalDegree.description: Latitude of the location in decimal degrees.

longitudeDecimalDegree.description: Longitude of the location in decimal degrees.

deliveryTexts.description: Text relevant to the SHipment . This could be general Text, cancellation reason, return reason

textIdentifier.description: Identifier Code of the Text. All Texts should be qualified by a code in the future Roadmap. contains value like "SD","SO","ZGEN" etc

textDescription.description: Description associated with the Text Identifier

textLineSequenceNumber.description: Sequence Number of the text if source has restrictions on the Text length

deliveryNoteItemNumber.description: In AFS, map from Delivery Schedule Line.  In S4, map from Delivery Item

systemItemCode.description: Source System internal Product code . unique code for product - size.

qualityCode.description: The first two alphanumeric characters of the Apparel Footwear Solution (AFS) Stock Category Code that uniquely identifies the quality of the product. Example: 01 (meaning A-Grade), 02 (meaning B-Grade), SS (meaning Salesman Samples)

inventorySegmentationCode.description: A set of characters that uniquely identifies how Products in a Warehouse are categorized for Inventory Management. This is used to separate Products needed for a specific purpose from other Inventory. Example: 000 (meaning No ISEG) TRN (meaning stock transfer) 001 (meaning Samples - Singles) DFZ (meaning Duty Free Zone) RTN (meaning Return)

batchNumber.description: SAP specific number to identify the size of a product

divisionCode.description: division footwear/apparel/equipment etc of the product . usually contains code 10/20/30/98

deliveryQuantity.description: quantity requested in the delivery note

packedQuantity.description: quantity packed across cartons for the delivery Note

receivedQuantity.description: quantity received in the goods receipt from Node

uOM.description: Unit of measure of the delivery item

originCountryCode.description: A code indicating the Manufacturing Country of Origin.  It is typically two characters in length.   Example: CN (China).

storageLocationCode.description: storage location in the node. values could be 1000, 2000

costCategoryCode.description: Category of what the cost relates to

paymentTypeCode.description: Method of payment PREPAID/COLLECT associated with the Delivery cost Category

costAmount.description:
Cost Amount for this Delivery.
Example: 125.99

costCurrency.description:
Currency Code associated with Cost Amount.  
Example: USD

idReferenceNumber.description: Functional key to indicate a certain Goods Holder

goodsHolderTypeSizeCode.description: Code to indicate the size of a goods holder (DC specific)

goodsHolderNumber.description:
THis is mostly the UCC of the goodsholder, This is a combination of one or more of the following values - Subcontractor manufacturer, Manufacturer ID, Factory Number, actual number of the goods holder and Check Digit.
In some cases this is a source specific carton identifier. example SD1, SIM uses their own identifier

alternateGoodsHolderNumber.description:
An alternate identifying number of the Goods Holder used to facilitate grouping, labeling, and/or payment across related Goods Holders.  It often contains the Parent Goods Holder number.
its also in some cases The actual number of the goods holder itself. This value can also be found as part of the goodsHolderNumber.

goodsHolderTrackingNumber.description: parcel tracking number;available for parcel shipments

goodsHolderSequenceNumber.description: The sequence number of the goods holder within the shipment

parentIndicator.description: Answers the question whether the current goods holder is the parent of a group of goods holders. For example: The parent goods holder gets the label with the price that needs to be paid by the customer if there is Cash On Delivery.

giftIndicator.description: Answers the question whether the current goods holder is gift or not

salesChannelTypeName.description:
Define Wholesale/Digital/Retail.
This is enumerated in swagger
enum:
        - DIGITAL
        - WHOLESALE
        - RETAIL

textIdentifier.description: Identifier Code of the Text. All Texts should be qualified by a code in the future Roadmap.

textDescription.description: Description associated with the Text Identifier

textLineSequenceNumber.description: Sequence Number of the text if source has restrictions on the Text length

costCategoryCode.description: Category of what the cost relates to

paymentTypeCode.description: Method of payment PREPAID/COLLECT associated with the SHipment cost Category

costCurrency.description:
Currency Code associated with Cost Amount.  
Example: USD

idReferenceNumber.description: Functional key of a goods holder item

productCode.description: A set of alphanumeric characters, comprised of the concatenation of a Style Code and Colorway Code, that uniquely identifies a specific Nike shoe, garment or equipment item as differentiated by color. Product Code is used both internally and externally. It is different from Product Identifier, an unstructured numeric value which is assigned immediately upon creation of the record for a new Product. Structure of affiliates' Product Code may be different. Third party alphanumeric Product Codes may match and conflict with Nike Product Codes in some instances. Example: 542367-010

sizeCode.description: One of a series of graduated dimensions by which manufactured inventory is classified, prior to any translation into international sizing equivalents. A conventional relative measure of dimension, as for Footwear, Gloves, Apparel, and other articles made up for sale. Synonym: Master Size Example:  S, M, L, XL, 7, 7.5, 8

systemItemCode.description: Source System internal Product code . unique code for product - size.

divisionCode.description: The code of the division to which this belong. 10/20/30/98

inventorySegmentationCode.description: A set of characters that uniquely identifies how Products in a Warehouse are categorized for Inventory Management. This is used to separate Products needed for a specific purpose from other Inventory. Example: 000 (meaning No ISEG) TRN (meaning stock transfer) 001 (meaning Samples - Singles) DFZ (meaning Duty Free Zone) RTN (meaning Return)

packedQuantity.description:
Quantity packed into Goods Holder.
Example: 3

uOM.description: Unit of measure of the delivery item

deliveryNoteNumber.description: The delivery note number connecting the shipped product back to a certain delivery that contains the product.

deliveryNoteItemNumber.description: The delivery note item number connecting the shipped product back to a certain delivery item.

itemSerialNumber.description: serial number of every item unit.

originCountryCode.description: The 2-letter ISO 3166-1 code of the country of origin of the product

originalItemReferences.description: The reference(s) of the original item(s) of this item. For example for hashed items.

productCode.description: A set of alphanumeric characters, comprised of the concatenation of a Style Code and Colorway Code, that uniquely identifies a specific Nike shoe, garment or equipment item as differentiated by color. Product Code is used both internally and externally. It is different from Product Identifier, an unstructured numeric value which is assigned immediately upon creation of the record for a new Product. Structure of affiliates' Product Code may be different. Third party alphanumeric Product Codes may match and conflict with Nike Product Codes in some instances. Example: 542367-010

sizeCode.description: One of a series of graduated dimensions by which manufactured inventory is classified, prior to any translation into international sizing equivalents. A conventional relative measure of dimension, as for Footwear, Gloves, Apparel, and other articles made up for sale. Synonym: Master Size Example:  S, M, L, XL, 7, 7.5, 8

inventorySegmentationCode.description: A set of characters that uniquely identifies how Products in a Warehouse are categorized for Inventory Management. This is used to separate Products needed for a specific purpose from other Inventory. Example: 000 (meaning No ISEG) TRN (meaning stock transfer) 001 (meaning Samples - Singles) DFZ (meaning Duty Free Zone) RTN (meaning Return)

packedQuantity.description:
Quantity packed into Goods Holder.
Example: 3

originCountryCode.description: A set of alphanumeric characters that uniquely identify the country where the Products are made and/or assembled. Synonym: Manufacturing Country of Origin Example: CN (meaning China)

referenceTypeCode.description: Type of Reference Attributes, populate this only when delivery item is not present.

goodsHolderItemTexts.description: Text relevant to the Goodsholder Item

textIdentifier.description: Identifier Code of the Text. All Texts should be qualified by a code in the future Roadmap.

textDescription.description: Description associated with the Text Identifier

textLineSequenceNumber.description: Sequence Number of the text if source has restrictions on the Text length

transportHolders.description: The Transport Holder(s) used for this shipment

idReferenceNumber.description: Functional key for a certain transport holder, concatenation of shipment_origin and transport holder number

transportHolderNumber.description: The unique identifier for a combination of shipments that is shipped together in the same Transport Holder

transportHolderLicensePlateNumber.description: The License Plate Number connected to a certain transport holder

transportHolderTypeCode.description: Type of Transport holder used for shipping

transportHolderTypeSizeCode.description: A code that indicates the size of a certain Transport Holder type, for instance the size of a transportHolder

transportHolderTypeSizeDescription.description: Description associated with transportHolderTypeSizeCode that indicates the size of a certain Transport Holder type

transportHolderSequenceNumber.description: Transport Holder Sequence Number when a shipment is split in multiple transport holders

transportVehicleCraftCode.description: This is vessel name in inbound and this comes for only Vessel.

transportHolderStatusCode.description: status of the Transport Holder LOADED/SHIPPED

sealNumber.description: After a transport holder is sealed at the origin the seal number is used to provide tamper evidence and security.

multipleBillOfLadingIndicator.description: Multiple Bill Of Lading Indicator , indicating whether the Transport holder contains more than one BOL (shipment)

loadLocationTypeCode.description: Code to identify the location where a transport holder is loaded. example "F'"-Factory

loadLocationTypeDescription.description: Description associated with the  load location type code where a transport holder is loaded

crossDockCode.description: Cross docking is moving products from an inbound trailer (or other transportation mode) to another trailer, without moving it in and out of inventory. This code is the original transport holder number before cross dock.

directDropIndicator.description: A transport holder is marked as Direct Drop if it goes straight out of the DC to the customer, without being unloaded at a carrier hub.

vendorAccessNumber.description: Nike will share access numbers with carriers, who communicate them with their truck drivers, who in turn need to show these access numbers to security to be able to pick up an outbound shipment

goodsHolderTypeCode.description: Indicates what type of goods holder is being counted in the "goodsHolderCount" field

goodsHolderCount.description: Number of goods holders connected to the transport holder

transportHolderItemCount.description: Number of units in the Transport Holder

carrierLoadTypeCode.description: Type of Carrier Load if the transport holder is a TL/LTL/parcel
